channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Why Alisa Liu's figure skating performance stood out
item.description: Figure skater Alysa Liu made a gold-winning comeback. She shared her new outlook on skating.
item.content:encoded: Figure skater Alysa Liu made a gold-winning comeback. She shared her new outlook on skating.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. Sánchez

item.title: SkiMo, the Winter Olympics' newest sport, takes the stage in Italy
item.description: The sport of ski mountaineering is new to the Winter Olympics this year but its origins go back more than a century in the Alps.
item.content:encoded: The sport of ski mountaineering is new to the Winter Olympics this year but its origins go back more than a century in the Alps.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: The 'doom loop' helps explain why the global economy is growing bleaker
item.description: How come it feels like it's all bad news in the global economy these days? According to one economist, something he calls the "doom loop."
item.content:encoded: How come it feels like it's all bad news in the global economy these days? According to one economist, something he calls the "doom loop."
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: Did climate change factor into the Lake Tahoe avalanche? Turns out it's complicated
item.description: As the climate warms, scientists are trying to better understand avalanche risks. The say risks for major avalanches at high elevation could be growing while the risk is decreasing at low elevations.
item.content:encoded: As the climate warms, scientists are trying to better understand avalanche risks. The say risks for major avalanches at high elevation could be growing while the risk is decreasing at low elevations.
item.dc:creator: Ezra Romero

item.title: U.K. whistleblower says his police tip led to former Prince Andrew's arrest
item.description: Days before ex-prince Andrew's arrest, an anti-monarchy group filed a police report alleging criminal activity by the king's brother.
item.content:encoded: Days before ex-prince Andrew's arrest, an anti-monarchy group filed a police report alleging criminal activity by the king's brother.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Willow continues to defy expectations with surprise new album 'Petal Rock Black'
item.description: Singer and musician Willow released her seventh full-length album Petal Rock Black as complete surprise, continuing defy expectations with her music.
item.content:encoded: Singer and musician Willow released her seventh full-length album Petal Rock Black as complete surprise, continuing defy expectations with her music.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: '10% Happier' author Dan Harris talks about a moment of kindness from a stranger
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. 10% Happier author Dan Harris talks about a moment of kindness from a stranger.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. 10% Happier author Dan Harris talks about a moment of kindness from a stranger.

item.title: Supreme Court strikes down Trump's tariffs
item.description: The Supreme Court struck down President Trump's sweeping tariffs. We examine the court's opinion and the impact of tariffs on the broader economy.
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court struck down President Trump's sweeping tariffs. We examine the court's opinion and the impact of tariffs on the broader economy.
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: How more than 240 million gallons of sewage flowed into the Potomac River
item.description: NPR's Erika Ryan reports from the site of one of the nation's largest sewage spills ever — just outside of Washington, D.C. — in January.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Erika Ryan reports from the site of one of the nation's largest sewage spills ever — just outside of Washington, D.C. — in January.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: 'Bookworm' host Michael Silverblatt dies
item.description: His KCRW show in which he interviewed authors was nationally syndicated until 2022. He was 73.
item.content:encoded: His KCRW show in which he interviewed authors was nationally syndicated until 2022. He was 73.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong
